intro: Cephalophora vallenariensis, commonly known as the Vallenariense Cephalophora, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
